description:
Civil Engineer - Exciting Opportunity in Canberra's Leading Developer & Construction Group
 
Are you an experienced civil engineer seeking a challenging role with a reputable development construction group? Join our team in Canberra and become an integral part of our innovative projects, including the groundbreaking Yowani Grounds Development and The Garema Place Hotel.
 
About the Projects:
Yowani Grounds：
Led by local Canberra developer TP Dynamics, renowned for its focus on large community projects, Yowani Grounds is poised to become Canberra's largest mixed-use development. Positioned strategically at the intersection of Canberra's main entry axis, this project will create a vibrant mini-city comprising over 1000 residences, complemented by retail establishments, cafes, and inviting public areas.
The Garema Place Hotel：
The Garema Place Hotel will be a 10-storey mixed-use hotel building on a 1500sqm site. It will contain 3 basement car park levels and amenities comprising around 238 hotel rooms, multiple restaurants and bars, a wellness center, function rooms, and ballrooms. The development will also feature a center skylight atrium with an acrylic-bottomed pool and multiple outdoor garden terraces on the top levels.
Responsibilities:
Project Leadership: Lead civil engineering efforts throughout all phases of the development, ensuring adherence to project objectives, timelines, and quality standards.
Design Integration: Collaborate closely with architects, urban planners, and other stakeholders to integrate civil engineering solutions seamlessly into the overall project design, optimizing functionality, sustainability, and aesthetic appeal.
Infrastructure Planning: Oversee the planning and design of essential infrastructure components, including roads, utilities, stormwater management systems, and landscaping elements, to support the needs of the mixed-use precinct.
Construction Management: Provide technical oversight during the construction phase, liaising with contractors, subcontractors, and regulatory agencies to ensure compliance with specifications, codes, and regulations.
Risk Management: Identify and assess potential risks and challenges associated with civil engineering aspects of the project, developing proactive strategies to mitigate risks and maintain project continuity.
Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with project stakeholders, including clients, government agencies, and community representatives, to communicate project requirements, address concerns, and foster positive relationships.
 
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related field; 
Minimum of 5 years of experience in civil engineering, with a focus on large-scale development projects.
Proficiency in relevant civil engineering software and tools, such as AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and hydraulic modeling software.
Strong communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively in multidisciplinary teams.
 
Be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking team dedicated to shaping the future of urban development in Canberra. 
 
 
Apply now to join us as a Civil Engineer and embark on a rewarding career journey with TP Dynamics.

description:
About Karbon


Karbon is the global leader in practice management software for growth-minded accounting firms. We provide an award-winning, highly collaborative cloud platform that streamlines work and communication, enabling the average accounting firm using Karbon to save 16 hours per week, per employee.


We have customers in 34 countries and have grown into a globally distributed team, with our people based throughout the US, Australia, New Zealand, Canada and the United Kingdom. We are well-funded, ranked #1 on G2, have a fantastic team culture, are growing rapidly, and making a global impact.




About Karbon


Karbon is the global leader in practice management software for growth-minded accounting firms. Our award-winning, collaborative cloud platform streamlines work and communication, enabling significant time savings and efficiency gains. With customers in 34 countries and a globally distributed team, Karbon is growing rapidly and making a global impact.


Position Overview


Seeking software engineers skilled in balancing efficiency and excellence. Ideal candidates thrive in teamwork, innovate, and maintain products while valuing autonomy and creativity. We prioritize ownership and impact, welcoming diversity, passion, and authenticity in a collaborative, sincere environment.


Key Responsibilities






Balance Speed and Quality
—You adeptly balance the need for speed with a commitment to quality. You know when to accelerate to meet deadlines and when to focus on detail for perfect outcomes. You have the judgment to navigate these priorities effectively, maintaining a keen eye for both efficiency and excellence.




Work effectively as part of a team
—Software development is a team sport, where solo victories are rare. It thrives on your robust collaboration and dedication to supporting your colleagues. You contribute to a harmonious blend of focused work and engaging discussions, flexible between home and office settings, ensuring everyone can contribute to the team's success. You are eager to be part of an exceptional team, ready to invest your efforts towards collective achievements.




Build and maintain
—Your role involves developing innovative products and ensuring the continuous operation of existing ones. You appreciate not only the allure of new technologies but also the importance of iterative improvements on established systems. Your commitment to pioneering and preservation is crucial.




Autonomy
—You are inherently curious, finding joy in learning and exploration. Faced with challenges and direction rather than predefined solutions, you engage fully and creatively with problems.




Own your work
—You take genuine pride in your creations, feeling a deep sense of responsibility for the products you develop and their impact on customers. This sense of ownership is paramount, and you share this commitment.




Bring your passion and personalit
y—Your creativity, curiosity, and authentic self make the team stronger. If you've worked in highly political environments, you'll find our culture, free from office politics and valuing openness and authenticity, a refreshing change.




Qualifications




We are primarily a .NET-focused team, seeking candidates proficient in C#, SQL Server, and .NET technologies (MVC, Web API, .NET Core). That said, candidates with demonstrated ability to repeatedly and successfully adapt to new technologies over several years will also be considered.


Team versatility is important, so experience with JavaScript/TypeScript is considered a plus. 


Strong communication skills are essential for our international, multi-locational team dynamics.


Candidates should understand scalable systems, software architecture, data structures, and algorithms. 


Familiarity with the full software development life cycle and engineering best practices is required.


A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience is needed.






Karbon embraces diversity and inclusion, aligning with our values as a business. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. If you've made it this far in the job description but your past experience doesn't perfectly align, we do encourage you to still apply. You could still be the right person for the role!


When we look for talent to join our team, we want unique, creative, and amazing people that align with values, and help us build a world-class product and company.


Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to who we are, and what has always made us tick.


We recruit and reward people based on capability and performance. We don’t discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion, physical or cognitive ability, and other diversity dimensions, that may hinder inclusion in the organization.


Generally, if you are a good person, we want to talk to you. 😛


If there are any adjustments or accommodations that we can make to assist you during the recruitment process, and your journey at Karbon, contact us at 
[email protected]
 for a confidential discussion.


At this time, we request that agency referrals are not submitted for this position. We appreciate your understanding and encourage direct applications from interested candidates. Thank you!
title: .NET Engineer

description:
TAFE NSW Life-Changing Careers


Senior Client Applications Engineer


TAFE Worker Level 9


Location: Negotiable within a TAFE NSW Campus


Full-time Permanent Position


Base salary range of $119,757 - $132,188 p.a plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading


At TAFE NSW, we are dedicated to life-changing impact.


We invest in our people


We provide you with tools and ongoing training and professional development, health and wellbeing programs, and a 35-hour working week with a variety of flexible working options.


About the role


The Senior Client Applications Engineer is responsible for supporting and implementing the tools and processes to package, deploy and secure end user applications across a large and geographically dispersed organisation. The position works closely with internal and external stakeholders to support end to end application lifecycle services that comply with TAFE NSW’s cyber security strategic approach and policies. The position works broadly and collaboratively with security engineers and other specialists and has an afterhours on-call requirement to meet business needs.


We have 1 x permanent position with hybrid and flexible work arrangements and negotiable location within NSW (Subject to campus availability).


About You


As a Senior Client Applications Engineer, you will have advanced scripting, automation and software deployment experience using Intune, Configuration Manager (SCCM) and Jamf Pro. You have worked in large and complex IT infrastructure and have experience successfully deploying various technologies across the business.


You will have considerable experience in end user application packaging and deployment with specialist technical capabilities relevant to a large, complex organisation. You will also have demonstrated experience applying information security and/or cyber security principles and concepts and ability to work on-call afterhours to meet operational requirements.


You enjoy working with others and ensure adequate support is provided throughout the project lifecycle. You place the customer at the centre of the decision making process and ensure industry trends, software developments and innovative technologies are considered.


You have attention to detail, excellent communication skills and are analytical. You take initiative in problem resolutions and enjoy collaborating with your team to ensure seamless delivery of service.


Highly Regarded




Ability to maintain a secure and consistent end user environment through the use of relevant tools, group policies, and scripting languages for Windows and Mac operating systems.


Experience automating the delivery of and securing end user applications using Intune, Config Manager, Jamf Pro and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.


Experience designing and implementing security controls to meet standards set forth in cybersecurity frameworks, such as the Australian Signals Directorate Essential Eight.




Don’t miss this opportunity to join a supportive, specialist team where your growth and personal development is valued.


To find out more about the role, click to view the 
Position Description
.


Our commitment to Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion


We are committed to creating a culturally safe and accessible workplace where dignity, trust, respect, and the promotion of diversity and inclusion are valued, so you can safely bring your whole self to work and connect with your community through our many diverse employee networks.


If you require an adjustment in the recruitment process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Advisor listed below.


A career of life-changing impact awaits you. Apply now! 


Applications close: Sunday 26 May at 11.55pm


To apply for this role, click on 'apply now' and provide:




Your current resume


Response to one targeted question below when prompted within the application process (300 words)




Targeted Question:
 The Senior Client Application Engineer role involves working with multiple platforms to deliver applications and configurations to end user devices at TAFE campuses across NSW. Describe your experience with managing end user applications for various device types (Windows, Mac, mobile) and demonstrate your ability to employ appropriate security controls to meet organisational security requirements. (300 words)

: Contact Stjepan Stanic, Manager Client Applications via email 
[email protected]


General recruitment and adjustment enquiries
: contact Talent Acquisition Advisor, Sarah Aitchison via email

 or call 
0435 078 206
.


For helpful insights into preparing your application, TAFE NSW’s recruitment process, and getting interview ready, read through our 
Application Process
 and the interactive 
Capability Application Tool
.  


This is a child-related position. 
A Working with Children Check
 is a prerequisite for anyone in child-related work. It involves a national criminal history check and review of findings of workplace misconduct. 


For ongoing positions in the NSW Public Sector, you need to be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident of Australia or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport.


An eligibility list, valid for 18 months, may be created for this position, and position(s) of the same classification that subsequently becomes vacant, may be filled via this eligibility list.

title: Senior Client Applications Engineer

description:
How did you think you’d make your living growing up? 
 The term 'DevOps' didn't exist.
 But I bet you didn’t aspire to work in a government office in Canberra. Building platforms for taxation. Superannuation. Or the births deaths and marriages registry, did you? 
  
 You probably thought about making a product that makes a difference. Work that meant something. So how about you help tackle the cost of living crisis in Australia, whilst supporting a move to green energy? 
  
 You’d join a team of 30, with around 10 tech specialists ranging from data, developers, embedded software and electronics engineers.
 They’re taking a world-first approach to solar energy. Creating a platform that allows its users to trade energy through a sophisticated system of remote networks and VPNs deployed, nationally. 
 Sure anyone can put solar panels on their roof. But leveraging novel solar, battery and inverter technology. Combined with an intelligent networking platform. You can help make things… Well, a lot smarter. 
 
What you’ll be doing…
  
 The platform is stable now. But with a capital raise planned this year to drive product sales there’s a lot to do across GCP, provisioning new services, migrating to Kubernetes and building better monitoring. 
  
 This is your chance to shape the networking and cloud infrastructure, server architecture and security compliance. There’s already a strong DevOps philosophy. So tools like Terraform, Crossplane, Docker, Postgres and Kafka are already there. 
  
 The advantage of doing this early on in a small business is things will move quickly. You can access the knowledge you need to get into the weeds for provisioning new services. 
 You’ll enjoy the flexible hours and option to work from home 4 days a week. If you drive an electric car, you can charge it at work for free. In the summer months, you can enjoy the additional annual leave provided over the standard 20 days. 
 
What you’ll need… 
 You’re the kind of person who enjoys diving deep into networking. We’ll also need you to bring experience in Linux, Python and Cloud Infrastructure. 
 If you’re used to working in small, agile environments great. If you’re from a more corporate background and looking for less red tape, that’s fine too.
 To find out more and for an informal chat, get in touch with me at 
[email protected]
 / 
0406 158 832
. 
 
 Don’t worry about updating your CV just yet, we can worry about that later.

Location:
 Beard ACT
Are you a skilled detailer with a strong engineering background and a passion for precision in structural design? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our dynamic team as a Frame and Truss Detailer. As a leader in Steel Frames and Trusses manufacturing, we are seeking a detail-oriented individual with hands-on experience in FRAMECAD software to contribute to our innovative projects.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with architects, engineers, and project managers to create accurate and detailed designs for frame and truss systems.
Utilize your expertise in FRAMECAD software to develop comprehensive structural plans, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Interpret architectural drawings and translate them into precise technical specifications for manufacturing and construction.
Identify potential design improvements and provide suggestions to optimize structural integrity, cost-efficiency, and construction timelines.
Communicate effectively with internal teams and external stakeholders to address design-related queries and concerns.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Structural Engineering, Civil Engineering or related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience working as a Frame and Truss Detailer, demonstrating a strong understanding of structural design principles.
Proficiency in using FRAMECAD software for detailed design and drafting.
Solid knowledge of relevant codes, regulations, and standards related to frame and truss systems.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically in order to optimize designs.
Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and clients.
Detail-oriented mindset with a dedication to delivering accurate and error-free designs.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Benefits:
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work with a diverse team of industry experts on cutting-edge projects.
Professional growth and development through ongoing training and learning opportunities.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values innovation and creativity.
Chance to contribute to the success of impactful projects that shape the construction industry.
If you are a detail-driven individual with a passion for precision and a solid background in engineering, along with proven experience using FRAMECAD software, we encourage you to apply. Join us in creating exceptional designs that drive innovation and excellence in the Steel Frames and Trusses manufacturing field.
How to Apply:
Please submit your resume, a cover letter outlining your relevant experience, and a portfolio showcasing your FRAMECAD software projects. We look forward to reviewing your application and getting to know you better.
 
ENFRAME an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

description:
Our Why
 
Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in people’s lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow. 
The Nuts and Bolts
We have over 6,500 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.49 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
Our Team
Datacom Group Technology is responsible for the provision of company-wide technology services which are critical to the business because they:
 
Support business processes that through their efficiency (speed, accuracy, and cost per transaction) give the organization a competitive edge.
 
Deliver an end user experience that supports enhanced employee engagement and productivity.
 
Allow the business to scale without incurring corresponding increases in cost.
 
Support business growth through diversification of service offerings.
 
About the role
The Systems Engineer role is responsible for supporting Datacom's technical infrastructure including corporate hardware and software as well as providing corporate systems for the Datacom Business. The Systems Engineer primarily performs support activities in our corporate Production Environment, including responsibility for infrastructure changes following formal change control process. This role will also assist with Priority incidents and internal projects as opportunities present themselves.
The Systems Engineer position would suit someone keen to take the next step in their career. We're after people who exude common sense and professionalism, are team players, can work under pressure with minimum supervision and who can demonstrate exceptional problem-solving abilities and a passion for learning.
Please note this is a 6 month fixed term position 
What you'll bring
As an experienced professional, you'll be a success-driven and naturally passionate about technology, using it to deliver great customer outcomes. You will be comfortable engaging with and supporting all levels of customers from technical staff through to executives and your attention to detail will ensure your deliverables are of the highest standards.
Ideally, your Technical Skills will encompass some or all of the following:
 
Advanced Windows 10/11 troubleshooting experience
 
Basic Windows server experience
 
All-rounder in Microsoft Products
 
Microsoft O365 Admin
 
Microsoft Intune
 
Microsoft Security/ Defender, MFA
 
Azure / Azure AD
 
Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Group Policy
 
Exchange Online and on-premises
 
Remote access, VPN, LAN, Wireless
 
Experience with SCCM/ BigFix
 
Meeting Room technologies e.g. AV equipment
 
Ability to work on problems of diverse scope
 
Min of 3+ years experience in a similar role and environment
 
Why Datacom?
Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealand’s largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us. 
We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. You’ll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment. We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealand’s largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities. We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported. 
If you would like to know more and this sounds like you. Please apply online today!
title: Systems Engineer | Fixed Term - Canberra

description:
Why MTP Services?
 
We are an independent tech consultancy putting people at the heart of technology to help advance the way we work, enhance the way we live, and plan for a brighter tomorrow. At MTP Services, we cherish sparks over cogs, aiming to provide an environment where every individual can shine in their unique way. This role encourages ownership and initiative, as you engage in designing robust front-end interfaces and constructing resilient backend systems. With a focus on technical decision-making and architectural contributions, this position is ideal for someone with a solid foundation in computer science and a desire to apply their seasoned skills in web development, database management, and modern development practices. Manage database operations, ensuring robustness and efficiency in data handling and storage.

Drive the integration of sophisticated front-end UIs with back-end services, optimising for performance and scalability.
 
Uphold and advocate for high coding standards, contributing to code reviews and the mentoring of junior developers.
 
Proactively stay abreast of, and implement, emerging development tools and technologies.
 
Troubleshoot effectively, identifying, and rectifying defects to enhance software reliability and lead problem-solving efforts.
 
 
Qualifications
 
 
A tertiary degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field is preferred.
 
3-5 years of hands-on experience in full stack development.
 
A comprehensive understanding of web development and design principles across multiple platforms.
 
Proficiency in managing and utilising database systems, including both SQL and NoSQL options.
 
Well-versed in API design and development, with a history of integrating complex systems.
 
 
We Offer
 
 
As role where you're encouraged to be your best, supported by above-average salaries and truly insane perks.
 
A culture that values flexibility, growth, and personal achievement over rigid structures.
 
An environment that’s anything but ordinary, where your work is about making a real impact.

description:
Job Title: Civil & Hydraulic Engineer
Company Overview:
 
Involved in various Civil & Construction Works throughout NSW and ACT, Civil & Civic has a range of upcoming projects. Our Senior Management Team boast over 20 years of construction experience, and our employees have been hand-picked to integrate a range of specialist knowledge and skills to complement each project we undertake.
Position Overview:
 
We are seeking a highly skilled Civil Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both civil engineering, with a passion for designing and implementing innovative solutions to complex challenges. This role offers the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects, from infrastructure development to water resource management.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop comprehensive engineering designs and solutions.
Conduct site assessments and surveys to gather data and assess project feasibility.
Design and analyse hydraulic systems, including pipelines, stormwater management systems, and irrigation networks.
Prepare detailed engineering plans, drawings, and specifications using industry-standard software.
Perform hydraulic calculations and simulations to optimize system performance and efficiency.
Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and guidelines throughout the project lifecycle.
Provide technical expertise and support during construction and commissioning phases.
Participate in project meetings, presentations, and client interactions to communicate progress and address concerns.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering, Hydraulic Engineering, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
Proficiency in engineering design software such as AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and HEC-RAS.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and optimize designs.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively collaborate with colleagues and clients.
Knowledge of relevant industry standards, regulations, and best practices.
Benefits:
Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
Professional development opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.
Dynamic work environment with opportunities for growth and leadership.
How to Apply:
 If you are passionate about engineering excellence and eager to contribute to impactful projects, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and relevant experience to [email address]. Be sure to include “Civil & Hydraulic Engineer” in the subject line of your email. We look forward to hearing from you!

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively collaborate with colleagues and clients.
Knowledge of relevant industry standards, regulations, and best practices.
Benefits:
Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
Professional development opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.
Dynamic work environment with opportunities for growth and leadership.
How to Apply:
 If you are passionate about engineering excellence and eager to contribute to impactful projects, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and relevant experience to [email address]. Be sure to include “Civil & Hydraulic Engineer” in the subject line of your email. We look forward to hearing from you!

description:
Offering a full-time, ongoing position


Access to our state-of-the-art technology to educate 


Empower the next generation of learners 




 
About the Role
 


The School is currently seeking to appoint an innovative, collaborative, and passionate IT teacher to join the Digital Innovation Department. The successful candidate will possess not only exemplary teaching and communication skills but also a high level of technical proficiency in coding and programming. 


The ideal candidate will possess advanced programming abilities, particularly in Python, Java, or JavaScript. Additionally, proficiency in algorithm design and computer science fundamentals is essential. Moreover, experience in utilizing IoT and machine learning technologies would be highly valued. 


We are looking for an individual who is not only capable of delivering effective lessons but also enthusiastic about fostering a dynamic and engaging learning environment. If you believe you possess these qualities and are eager to contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. 


 
About You
 


You are dedicated, passionate and possess the following: 




Experience teaching IT in a similar teaching environment 


Proven passion for the learning and holistic development of students in and beyond the classroom 


Proven experience of modelling outstanding teaching practice in and beyond the classroom 


Proven subject expertise and the ability to teach inclusively across a broad age and ability range 


Proven commitment to collaborative professional engagement and professional learning 


Experience of, or willingness to train for, teaching the Australian Curriculum and, where relevant, the Higher School Certificate and/or the International Baccalaureate 


Enthusiastic commitment to participating in the School’s pastoral and co-curricular program  


Clear commitment to respecting the School’s Anglican ethos and spirit of inclusion 


Firm commitment to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children 




All team members at CGS are required to have: 




Appropriate qualifications 


A valid ACT Working with Vulnerable People Card 


A current National Police Check; and 


Full working rights within Australia.
 
 




Benefits for you
 


As a CGS team member, you have access to a range of additional benefits, including: 




A highly competitive salary and superannuation of 12.5% (for permanent team members) 


Staff awards programme and generous professional development funding 


Attractive salary packaging arrangements 


Complimentary daily barista-made coffee  


Delicious daily morning tea and discounted lunches 


Access to the onsite health clinic and annual influenza vaccinations 


24/7 access to our Employee Assistance Programme 


14 weeks of paid parental leave 


School fee concessions 


Free parking 




Working at CGS
 


We aim to provide a vibrant and rewarding workplace that showcases your skills with a strong commitment to your professional learning. Working at Canberra Grammar School you will join a community committed to delivering the highest standard of education, inspiring students to achieve personal excellence within a warm and inclusive environment. 


We are continuously growing our CGS community with people who are passionate and energetic in their profession and who place student learning and well-being at the forefront of all they do. We invite candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.  


How to Apply
 


Please click ‘Apply’ button and submit the following documents: 




Cover letter (addressing the selection criteria on the Position Description) 


Resume/CV 




CGS is proud to be a School that takes child protection very seriously. All candidates for roles at Canberra Grammar School are subject to screening and assessment against child safety standards as part of our thorough recruitment process. 


An early application is advised as we reserve the right to close the vacancy early if sufficient suitable applications are received.
title: Information Technology Teacher

description:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER
ABOUT GEOSCAPE AUSTRALIA
Geoscape Australia is a leader in location intelligence. We are committed to building a smarter, more productive Australia by delivering data products and services that have impact on the everyday lives of Australian’s, by powering enterprise and enabling good government. Geoscape Australia is widely recognised as delivering economic, social and environmental outcomes across the economy, through its customer and partner ecosystem.
ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a key role within a development team to design, collaborate and execute the technical vision of Geoscape's Continuous Data Platform.
This exciting role is responsible for delivering technical solutions, contributing to the vision, and designing and developing frameworks and components which make up the continuous data platform. You’ll work with the team to execute on technical solutions driving product goals, and break down product features into actionable, deliverable items of work.
Strong Technical and collaborative skills are essential to support both the success of the team and the company at large.
WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR
A creative problem-solver with strong technical skills, and a desire to deliver the products our customers need.
You’ll bring:
Strong technical design, engineering, and architecture skills
3+ years of software development experience, with a preference for Python.
2+ years of experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud platform, with a preference for AWS 
Working knowledge of Docker, IaC and CI/CD tools 
The ability to grasp a problem, assess solutions and take action to implement them
The ability to communicate complex concepts in plain language.
A willingness to own and operate the systems you’re building
An understanding and commitment to working in short cycles, pair programming and delivering product iteratively.
The desire to always learn new skills and techniques, and to share your knowledge with the team.
The ability to manage work with innovation time
SKILLS
We look forward to you providing examples of your skills and experience in:
Delivering solutions that meet customer needs
Improving technical standards
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
The ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team. 
It would be advantageous but not essential if you have experience with:
Both SQL and NoSQL
Geospatial data 
Web frontend implementation experience using ReactJS or similar
Machine Learning
Tools We Use
Some of the tools we use in our day-to-day work include:
Python
PostgreSQL/PostGIS
PyCharm
Docker
AWS: RDS, Lambda, Kinesis, S3, ECS, DynamoDB
Git, GitHub, Jira
 
JOIN OUR TEAM OF INNOVATORS
Data was once an abstract idea. Today it’s woven through our lives, linking the physical and the digital, informing the choices we make in rapidly evolving social and geographical landscapes.
Geoscape Australia is a trusted source of spatial data, and an independent and self-funded company owned by the governments of Australia.
Promoting innovation is our cause. In the data-driven economy, our data powers new technologies, products and processes, improves productivity and stimulates economic growth.
With a history of collaboration and a culture of shared thinking, we push beyond what we know today to approach new challenges with a fresh perspective.
The result? For businesses and governments, the data required to make better decisions. For our people, the chance to build a meaningful career solving real-world problems.
 
OUR VALUES
We’re passionate about building a smarter, more productive Australia and we put our people first in the decisions we make. Our teams are passionate about our products and have a genuine desire for the growth of not only Geoscape’s products but each other.
We have a transparent team of experienced Senior Leaders who channel clear expectations and goals with regular performance feedback and recognition.
Most importantly we are a respectful, inclusive and friendly workplace and each of our team members proudly role model the company values; 
Trusted | Courageous | Inclusive
 
BENEFITS
Flexible working arrangements to support you to thrive at work and at home
A commitment to professional development, including an annual professional development allowance
Regular one on one check-ins with clear conversations on OKRs and real time feedback
Salary sacrifice arrangements
Employee surveys and other feedback mechanisms
Healthy workplace initiatives
An annual doona day
And…we have fun!
 
Geoscape Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.
 
HOW TO APPLY
Apply using the apply here link in this job ad, please note only short listed candidates will be contacted.
Please no recruiters, we are happy to go this one alone.
title: Software Engineer

description:
We're on the lookout for talented Cloud Engineers
We are seeking skilled Cloud Engineers to work as part of our multidisciplinary teams delivering high-quality digital products and solutions to our diverse range of clients. While permanent team members sit at the top of our preferences, contractors are also highly encouraged to apply. 
We welcome those who have experience in related roles.
Key Responsibilities
Demonstrate the ability to identify and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for applications and infrastructure and provide timely alerts upon any fluctuations or deviations. 
Successfully design, develop, and maintain automation pipelines contributing to effective continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices. 
Proactively escalate, respond to, and resolve incidents, showing initiative, and minimising system downtime and disruption, reinforcing a culture of open and honest collaboration. 
Show proficiency in designing, developing, and maintaining cloud infrastructure templates in accordance with client requirements, and ensuring their seamless deployment and maintenance. 
Uphold security best practices, ensuring full compliance with industry standards, regulations, and client IT Security Advisers' policies, enhancing the security posture of the projects. 
Foster an environment of agile teamwork and shared problem-solving, collaborating regularly with team members to meet project, client, and sprint goals. 
Embrace learning and development opportunities by acquiring new technical skills and methodologies, demonstrating the ability to contribute innovative solutions to system challenges and blockers. 
Adhere to set deadlines and ensure open, honest, and transparent communication with the team when faced with blockers or challenges, promoting the timely resolution of issues. 
Champion the dismantling of silos and fostering collaboration and communication within teams, thereby improving cross-functional teamwork and the overall work environment. 
 
Who We Are:
At GoSource, we are a world-class digital services company that combines innovation and technical excellence to deliver remarkable outcomes. 
Our leaders are recognised globally as thought leaders, and leaders of high-performing teams on award-winning projects. Our teams are made up of exceptional individuals who are great at what they do and enjoy working together to create meaningful change. 
What we do: 
GoSource makes exciting innovative digital products, working with modern technologies, pioneering experimental stacks and deploying future-focused design thinking tools. 
We have delivered and continue to work on projects of national and international significance. Our impactful work delivers outcomes that can make a real difference in the world. 
Why GoSource?
Our people are at the heart of what we do. We nurture talent by investing in our people, ensuring that each person thrives within our powerhouse multidisciplinary teams. 
We offer flexible work arrangements like working from home and part-time schedules, embracing a work-life balance that fuels both personal growth and professional excellence.
Next Steps:
Apply Online: If this sounds like you, click ‘quick apply’. By doing so, you’re consenting to our retention of your details for future potential role considerations.
If you have any further questions, please connect with us at: 
[email protected]
.
At GoSource, skills and capability speak louder than labels. We're here for your talent and the unique perspective you bring to the team.
Check out our website at https://gosource.com.au
